sn11.15:1: At Sāvatthī in Jeta's Grove. Then Sakka, lord of the devas, approached the Blessed One, paid homage to him, stood to one side, and said to him: "Venerable sir, what is a delightful place?"sn.i.233
sn11.15:2: v.913"Shrines in parks and woodland shrines,Well-constructed lotus ponds:These are not worth a sixteenth partOf a delightful human being.
sn11.15:3: v.914"Whether in a village or forest,In a valley or on the plain—Wherever the arahants dwellIs truly a delightful place."
